definition: medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: During a seance the medium was offering to bring people back from the other world.
sentences.chinese: 在降神会期间里，灵媒表演把人们从其他的世界带回。

sentences.english: What's the best way for me to get to mediumship?
sentences.chinese: 成为灵媒的最好的方法是什么？

sentences.english: You're really going to run this whole psychic thing into the ground,huh?
sentences.chinese: 你是真打算灵媒做到底了哈。

sentences.english: But is listening to our dreams right up there with calling a psychic hotline?
sentences.chinese: 但是倾听我们的梦境仅止于象打一个灵媒热线吗？

sentences.english: When the medium reabsorbed the ectoplasm this weight transfer was reversed.
sentences.chinese: 当灵媒重新吸收流质时，这个重量转移被反转。
柯南道尔，参加灵媒沙拉。

sentences.english: You were a medium in other lifetimes.
sentences.chinese: 在另一生中你曾是一位灵媒。

sentences.english: For anyone who is thinking about coming out as a psychic, this article is for you!
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章是为那些想知道灵媒是什么样子的人写的。

sentences.english: Well, the psychic got the first claim wrong.
sentences.chinese: 好的，灵媒的第一个宣称就错了。

sentences.english: Even president Lincoln (photo) had contact with mediums and took part in seances .
sentences.chinese: 甚至林肯总统也与灵媒有接触，而且参加了降神会。

sentences.english: She was delighted to learn I was a spirit medium.
sentences.chinese: 从此她就高兴地认为我是一个灵媒。

sentences.english: The fact that this psychic completely failed should not surprise anyone.
sentences.chinese: 灵媒完全没预测对，这个事实不值得惊讶。

definition: a ritual whereby the living soul is brought to the nether world for a spiritual journey
form of divination similar to the Ouija board, in which participants use their forefingers to push a small saucer over a sheet of paper inscribed with numerous Chinese characters
to expel spirits/(old) to end the period of mourning
to communicate with the spirits/psychic/(ears) sensitive/(information) accurate
